quiz_1_question.eng: True or false: Family rules should be set by the parents because our children are too young to decide for themselves.

quiz_2_question.eng:
Setting limits is also important for children. What do you think about this one?
Setting limits through household rules, daily routines, and healthy living is bad for your child because you are not allowing them to think on their own.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
âŒ Incorrect. 

ğŸ’š When you set reasonable limits with your child, you are not controlling your child too much. 

ğŸŒ· You are giving your child structure to maintain a positive parent-child relationship and explore the world safely.

ğŸ§¸ Setting reasonable limits with your child is a good form of positive discipline.

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f1_son_5.name is spending too much time watching TV before his homework is finished. Letâ€™s see how his mother, @data.characters.f1_mother.name, helps him create a family rule about this:

character_1_text.eng: It is important to finish your homework so you can do well in school. Letâ€™s make a rule about watching TV.

character_2_text.eng: Do I have to? I want to watch TV now.

rows.character_1_text: It is important to finish your homework so you can do well in school. Letâ€™s make a rule about watching TV.
rows.character_2_text: Do I have to? I want to watch TV now.

rows.character_1_text: I know itâ€™s hard, but what do you think would be a fair rule?

character_1_text.eng: I know itâ€™s hard, but what do you think would be a fair rule?

character_2_text.eng: Ummmâ€¦ maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework.

rows.character_2_text: Ummmâ€¦ maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework.

rows.character_1_text: I like that idea, but letâ€™s limit it to 1 hour per day. How does that sound?

character_1_text.eng: I like that idea, but letâ€™s limit it to 1 hour per day. How does that sound?

character_2_text.eng: Only one hour? Thatâ€™s not much. Fineâ€¦

rows.character_2_text: Only one hour? Thatâ€™s not much. Fineâ€¦

rows.character_1_text: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. Your marks have improved, too! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour and a half each dayâ€¦ as long as you still do your homework first!

character_1_text.eng: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. Your marks have improved, too! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour and a half each dayâ€¦ as long as you still do your homework first!

section_1_text.eng:
ğŸ“ Create rules with your child. You can write these down or use pictures when needed to help your Child understand.
â¸ Make one rule at a time.
ğŸ”‘ Talk about why the rule is important.

section_2_text.eng:
â­ Be realistic: make rules that your child can actually do.
ğŸ“– Be clear and specific about what you want.
âœ… Make sure the rule is fair and explain why it is needed.

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸ”„ Stick to the rule once it has been set. 
â¬†ï¸ your child will be more likely to follow the rule.
â–¶ï¸ If the rule includes you, it is important that you stick to it too.

section_4_text.eng:
â­ Praise your child for helping make the rule. 
ğŸ˜ƒ Praise your child when they follow the rule, just like you do when they behave well!
